Author: Alright#0419
Content: `komodo-cli -ac_name=STAKEDB1 oracleslist` will give you a list of oracles

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the one I'm testing right now is `c5ae01f5fad12bfc8bb24d6f8b1f3a02e72c94e153d544f16816e741f8d1f446`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: just need to do `komodo-cli -ac_name=STAKEDB1 oraclesregister c5ae01f5fad12bfc8bb24d6f8b1f3a02e72c94e153d544f16816e741f8d1f446 1000000`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then `komodo-cli -ac_name=STAKEDB1 sendrawtransactions $(komodo-cli -ac_name=STAKEDB1 oraclessubsribe c5ae01f5fad12bfc8bb24d6f8b1f3a02e72c94e153d544f16816e741f8d1f446 <pubkey> 1 | jq -r .hex)` a couple times

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then start chatsend and chatreceive with `STAKEDB1 c5ae01f5fad12bfc8bb24d6f8b1f3a02e72c94e153d544f16816e741f8d1f446`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so `./chatreceive STAKEDB1 c5ae01f5fad12bfc8bb24d6f8b1f3a02e72c94e153d544f16816e741f8d1f446` and `./chatsend STAKEDB1 c5ae01f5fad12bfc8bb24d6f8b1f3a02e72c94e153d544f16816e741f8d1f446`
